title: Blegd and Smeeg (Updated whenever I feel like it... GOSH!)
content:
[img]http://i34.photobucket.com/albums/d134/Galaxieretter/Number1Introductionssucknoextraline.png[/img]

So I decided to start the story for Blegd [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] and Smeeg [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] , original yorp and garg characters. This is not the Commander Keen comic I have been working on. I just needed a break.

If anyone can come up with a better name for the garg than "Blegd" please tell me. (By the way. Blegd is is my avatar. I find him cuter than Smeeg)

And I put an extra line at the end and posted it somewhere, if you have seen my other art you probably know where to find it.

*EDIT*

title: Re: Heoeodfsjfhbjkfbvbcb ogmmgm
content:
Xtraverse, being the most awesomest person alive that he is, hooked me up with some webspace on Spatang. I set up a webcomic-ish thing there. I want to update it every Monday and Friday. I am able to do one every day but if I work I won't be able to color it all in and everything.

You can bookmark this page.

[url=http://galaxie.spatang.com/]galaxie.spatang.com/[/url]

It will take you to the most recent comic. Right now it is just an empty shell.

(Oops I forgot to put the highlights and shadows on the latest comic. Oh well I'll fix it later. It's late... or should I say early?)


[quote]Quote:[hr]Its the expressions that get me; how did you get such an accurate expression of total idiocy? Did you use your picture or mine?[hr][/quote]
Haha! I used the people I see who order at work. Yorps and gargs were extremely hard to get emotions on. Especially the yorps where you only have one eye to show emotion with. Gargs are a bit more easy because they have two eyes. But it is still a challenge without eyebrows. What really got me was how to give a hug without arms...-----------------------

Well it is almost Wednesday (Edit: ALMOST?! It IS Wednesday, almost THURSDAY! Shows you how busy I have been.) and I finished the comic for Monday. I am sorry it is late but I tried some new things that made it take longer (Yet look better and cleaner.) and then life threw some of it's things into the mix taking up yet more time. I know no one cares about excuses so I will get to the point.

I am going to put out Monday's comic on Friday and hopefully it will give me more time to do Friday's comic which will be released on Monday...

Hopefully.

This is the holiday season... This means work is MAD busy. I am getting twice the amount of hours I would usually get and I now work to 11 PM instead of 9:30 PM. The last thing I want to do when I come home is draw. Between school and work I don't have that much time to do anything. So bare with me through the holidays and hopefully it will become more regular after Christmas.

Oh... how I hate the holiday.-----------------------

title: Going... going... gone.
content:
My Wacom tablet is dead.

Well not exactly, but it doesn't work for long. It keeps switching the pen to mouse mode for no apparent reason. I have to unplug it and plug it back in! Sometimes it won't even get any power AT ALL! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

So I am screwed. You see... I use my Wacom tablet to make B&S. I used it since #1. I would do the line art then color it digitally. And now that I use my tablet for 100% of the art I don't know what to do.

Man... this sucks. I think the cord got pulled or something. It has been like this for a while but finally died. I don't even want to THINK about using the mouse to color or draw.

Well... whatever.-----------------------

title: Re: Huh?
content:
One small "problem" I have with your comic, or rather the user interface, is the order of the buttons in the bar at the bottom, which is: [Previous] [First] [Archive] [Last] [Next]

It isn't immediately clear which button does what; I and probably most, got used to the old casette deck buttons: [>>] and [>|].

Other designs aren't necesarily bad of course, and yours aren't either, since there's text in the buttons, but I always expect "First" and "Last" to be the buttons on the outside.
Right now they're inside of the "Prev" and "Next" buttons
When I click the [Comic] button I get the last one, and if I want to go back 1 comic to see if I missed something, I always hover over [First] while reading to see if I'm over the right button, which I'm not.
I probably could have put that more eloquently, but I'm in a bit of a hurry. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
In other words, for me at least, the order is counter-inTUITive.

Maybe it's just me, but it's been bothering me, so I had to tell you, so others can tell me what an idiot I am, or maybe agree with me instead.
Looking forward to the next!Retodon8
